title: CUET holds 2-day confce on green architecture concludes
body: The two-day international conference titled International Conference on Green Architecture organised by the Chittagong University of Engineering and Technology concluded at the university in Chattogram on Friday. Organised jointly by the green architecture cell of the department of architecture of CUET, vice-chancellor the university Professor Mahmud Abdul Matin Bhuiyan was present as chief guest at the inaugural day of the conference, said a press release. He said, ‘Youth are the future builders of sustainable Bangladesh. The creativity, research and innovative vision of the youth will ensure a liveable Bangladesh of the future.’ In today’s world, universities are not only knowledge-providing institutions but also the driving force behind innovation, policy influence and industrial transformation, he said, adding that in building and community construction, they should not only be environmentally friendly but also supportive of human health, inclusive and sustainable. The special guests were Md Khalequzzaman Chowdhury, chief engineer of the public works department of the Ministry of Housing and Public Works; dean of the CUET’s faculty of architecture and planning Professor Muhammad Rashidul Hasan; and head of the department of architecture of BUET Professor SM Nazmul Imam, among others.
